message.body: /me tests

/me tests again and again

/me flies
/me thinks it's just ok
ive told nofish
there's no repo for zerochat, but I think zerochat should probably be kept lean as a tutorial thing
think it was more of a demo than anything
but if we improve this, then a repo should be made
we could get the jquery to just echo your msg back immediately when you send it, it'll appear snappier
other users will still recieve the msg after a few seconds
should be easy, might make the improvement for this fork
I will be back later
might make it rewrite zeronet urls with anchor tags
and regular urls will be highlighted in red
yeah I think that's the best way
don't want to clutter zerochat with these usability things
otherwise it's harder for people to concentrate on getting a simple zeronet site running
with the basics
also it seems to... reload all the messages?
when you send something?
the code looks like it clears everything on screen, then readds every message
that would explain the slight lag
I'll look at it later, need breakfast lol
yeah, also it would be good if the site owner could periodically purge messages
if it's useless
nah
but I can learn if it's useful
I know a bunch, but I prefer C/C++/JS
C style languages, I like most
C is great cause it will run anywhere
in theory :P
thoth, are you a lecturer by any chance? :P
I only dabble with C# for unity
java is ok, but it seems so 'heavy' to make things with
I generally choose languages based on performance/flexibility/platform
C# is too limiting for platforms
yeah, I thought about highlighting messages directed at you
yeah, that's why I don't like to concentrate on C#, but there's mono to compile it for other platforms
I need the speed of C/C++ for muh games! :D
and now I kinda want to stick to C/C++ and just recompile with clang/emscripten to everything else
yeah, I've heard that about haskell
yeah, I'm more excited about the decentralised websites
than torrents lol
so many potential things that can be made!!
list all features you would like :)
/me messages lucas
I'll make it not submit the message if you only input '/me' or '/me '
and probably add a little message telling them how to use the command properly
yeah
but I wonder if that may clutter the message queue, since they're stored forever
actually
it doesn't need to be put in the queue
yep
that's definitely going to be done
yep :)
I must eat and then run some errands, I will be back later

and update as neccesary
and then I can add notifications for people coming and going
